metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0821 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 36.0 allows user-assisted remote attackers to read arbitrary files or execute arbitrary JavaScript code with chrome privileges via a crafted web site that is accessed with unspecified mouse and keyboard actions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
